revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Brain Structure in Rodents
tldr: The author examines the structure of the brain in rodents, focusing on the cerebral cortex and the olfactory system. They identify various types of cortex and analyze the distribution of ganglionic formations and the central projections of the olfactory medulla. The study provides insights into the differences between the brains of rodents and humans, as well as the significance of sulci and fissures in structurally differentiated realms of the cortex.
